subject: Add MTM BMC Feature Control IPMI command
commitMessage:
Add MTM BMC Feature Control IPMI command

Certain features having security concerns needs to be enabled/disabled
only in manufacturing mode. Add a command to support the same for MCTP
feature.

In addition to starting or stopping a service, add an option to enable
or disable a service which will persist across AC cycles.

Request bytes:
Byte 1 – Supported features
     00h - MCTP
     01h to FFh - reserved (will be adding support for more features
as needed)
Byte 2 – Enable/Disable feature
    00h – Stops the given feature
    01h – Starts the given feature
    02h - Disables the given feature
    03h - Enables the given feature
    04h to FFh – reserved
Byte 3 - Custom feature arguments
  When byte 2 value is 00h:
    00h - MCTP over PCIe
    01h - MCTP over SMBus HSBP
    02h - MCTP over SMBus PCIe slot
    03h to FFh - reserved
Byte 4:5 – reserved

Tested:
Verified MCTP feature can be enabled/disabled as expected in MTM mode
the change will persist across AC cycles.

Signed-off-by: Arun P. Mohanan <arun.p.m@linux.intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Sumanth Bhat <sumanth.bhat@linux.intel.com>
Change-Id: I8f8be36ee3e0fd85cfb1e44599cd0db0a6a8d34a

nit: Can be moved to line 1159, so that it is grouped in netFnGeneral group of commands.
I believe it should be all features right?
at present it supports only mctp related services. We can extend it to other services on the need bassis.
yes. we will add support based on need.
nit: it might be conventional to provide the supported feature as first byte and enable/disable feature as subsequent byte
Is it verified after AC cycle as well?

I extended the command to provide service enable and disable options that will persist across AC cycles here: gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/intel-ipmi-oem/+/45970.

This is required for the PCIe scan disable.  Feel free to pull those changes into this commit if it makes more sense.  Thanks!
I pulled the changes to preserve service status across reboots to this commit.
it is not used any where.
i think it will be good if can return some status so that in failure cases we can return some error completion code.
Since idea is to extend for other needed features as well,can the method be made generic?
I think this method is indented only for  mctp. The same will not help for other services.
This is mctp specific. Only startOrStopService() can be generic.
we can break here. I don`t think we will have multiple services for same binding
Ack. Replaced with ipmi context pointers everywhere.
